intro: Baseonema lineare, commonly known as the linear baseonema, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
